intro: Crepidiastrum koshunense var. taiwanianum, commonly known as the Taiwan mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale purple or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
